comments:
Konstantin: I'll send this your way first (though it may be a problem in either
JavaProjectMigrationOperation or AddModulesToEARPropertiesPage); I used the "EAR
Modules" panel in the project properties to add a plain Java project to an EAR
(you can see the nature config traces prior to the exception, a ref to the
project was added in the EAR's .project and .component files; using
wtp-sdk-I200511131204.zip w/ head versions of jst.j2ee, jst.j2ee.ejb,
jst.j2ee.ui, jst.j2ee.web, wst.common.modulecore):

I couldn't repro it, but then again I am using a build from Fri, 11 Nov 2005 -- 
01:03 (UTC).

My guess is that there is an attempt to add the jst.java facet twice. 
Unfortunately, I can't really tell for sure because of how stack traces for 
multi-status core exceptions are printed. I believe that child statuses (the 
real problem(s)) should be visible by expanding the entry in the PDE Error Log.
This is working in WTP 1.5 RC2

traces.message: One or more constraints have not been satisfied.
